data.title: Special Event Station GB1URC: Introducing the Unicom Radio Club
data.meta_description: Join the Unicom Radio Club (URC) as we activate special event callsign GB1URC from August 8 to September 4, 2024. Connect with global amateur radio operators, exchange QSL cards, and be part of our international community. Learn more at unicomradio.com.
data.text:
The Unicom Radio Club (URC) is excited to announce the activation of our special event callsign GB1URC, running from August 8 to September 4, 2024. This event marks the official introduction of our international club to the amateur radio community. The station’s QTH is Glasgow (Scotland), located in Grid Locator IO75TT and WAB Square NS56.

About the Unicom Radio Club

The Unicom Radio Club is dedicated to bringing together amateur radio operators from around the world, fostering a community of knowledge sharing, cultural exchange, and international friendship.

Event Details

The activation of GB1URC serves multiple purposes:

Introduction of URC: This event introduces the Unicom Radio Club to the global amateur radio community, highlighting our mission and objectives.

Engagement: We aim to engage with radio enthusiasts globally, promoting the spirit of amateur radio.

Community Building: By connecting operators worldwide, we hope to build a strong and supportive community of amateur radio operators.

QSL Information

We are eager to confirm contacts made during this special event. QSL cards should be sent either directly or via the Online QSL Request System (OQRS). For detailed QSL information, please visit our QRZ page.

Join Us on the Airwaves

We invite all amateur radio operators to join us on the airwaves during this special activation period. This is an excellent opportunity to connect with a diverse group of radio enthusiasts and be part of an exciting new chapter in the amateur radio community.

For more information about the Unicom Radio Club, please visit our club page.

73! The Unicom Radio Club Team
